DOC.brief_summary: The aim study find utilization rate pattern primary health care service , process outcomes primary care consultation general population Hong Kong , whether family doctor would make difference . The study objectives determine 1. rate pattern utilization different primary health care service self-care 2 . Patient self-reported outcome ( global rating change health , satisfaction patient enablement ) primary care consultation ; 3. process care consultation include drug non-drug management , investigation , preventive care referral ; 4. effect regular family doctor service utilization rate pattern , health promotion practice , process outcomes primary care consultation .
DOC.brief_title: Study Primary Care Health Service Utilization Hong Kong
DOC.detailed_description: Study Design : A Cross-sectional general population survey longitudinal study ( 12-weeks follow ) Method : Two phase , correspond Summer Winter , respectively , cross-sectional telephone survey Hong Kong general population use structure questionnaire collect information choice primary care doctor , illness rate , primary care service utilization rate self-reported process outcome consultation . A longitudinal study 12 week carry sub-sample cross-sectional study subject collect data cross-validate cross-sectional data . Univariate multivariate regression analysis use determine whether difference service utilization rate , process outcome among people use different type primary care doctor .
DOC.criteria: Written consent study Nonresidential number Inability communicate Cantonese , Putonghua English Refusal telephone interview No contact 5 attempt
